thread.title: State budget impasse, is there an end in sight?
thread.title_full: State budget impasse, is there an end in sight?

title: State budget impasse, is there an end in sight?
text:
State budget impasse, is there an end in sight? 
Updated: Fri, Oct 16 2015, 10:24 PM 
By: CBS 21 Web Staff 
HARRISBURG, Pa. -- The state budget impasse is three and a half months old and there seems to be no end in sight. 
Evidence of that came in comments Friday by Governor Wolf, who directed his frustrations at the Republicans for the lack of an agreement. 
"I've made historic concessions on pension reform. I've made historic concessions on liquor reform. I've even reduced my request from March 3rd on expenditures by almost a billion dollars. So I have made a lot of compromises of offers. And what have I gotten in return? Nothing," Wolf said. 
The Pennsylvania Republican party issued a statement reacting to Wolf’s comments. It read, in part, that the governor would rather be on the campaign trail then at the negotiation tale. 
Republican lawmakers have objected to the governor’s call for a multi-billion dollar increase in taxes. Related Stories
